acceptance_tests: The game starts with an empty grid and a falling tetromino
Tetrominoes can be moved and rotated within grid bounds
Completed horizontal lines are removed and score increases accordingly
Game speed increases as more lines are cleared or time passes
The game ends when a new tetromino cannot be placed at spawn

constraints.gameplay_fidelity: Must conform to widely recognized classic Tetris rules
constraints.performance: Gameplay must be smooth with no noticeable input lag

goal: Design and implement a complete, playable version of the classic game Tetris.
open_questions: What target platform(s) should the game support (web, desktop, mobile)?
What programming language or engine is preferred?
Is this intended to be a single-player only implementation?
recommendations: Start with a minimal playable version focusing on core mechanics
Use a well-known Tetris guideline as a reference for behavior
Design the codebase to allow future extensions such as multiplayer

can: Include sound effects and background music
must: Include a game grid with standard tetromino shapes
Support tetromino movement: left, right, down, and rotation
Automatically drop tetrominoes over time with increasing speed
Detect and clear completed horizontal lines
Maintain and display a score based on cleared lines
End the game when new tetrominoes can no longer be placed
should: Implement standard Tetris scoring rules (single, double, triple, Tetris)
Allow soft drop and hard drop controls
Increase difficulty progressively as the game continues
